amendment.description: To help ensure impartial justice by requiring the Chief Justice of the United States to rule on motions to subpoena witnesses and documents and issues of privilege.

action.text: Motion to table amendment SA 1298 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 31.

Amendment SA 1298 proposed by Senator Van Hollen. (consideration: CR S768-769; text: CR S772) To help ensure impartial justice by requiring the Chief Justice of the United States to rule on motions to subpoena witnesses and documents and issues of privilege.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1298 proposed by Senator Van Hollen.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to table amendment SA 1298 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 53 - 47. Record Vote Number: 31.
